description: Umrah is a pilgrimage to the Ka'bah in Makkah that can be performed at any time of the year. Though not obligatory like Hajj, it is a highly recommended Sunnah act and a means of gaining immense spiritual reward and purification.

importance.text: Perform the Hajj and Umrah for Allah.
The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Umrah is an expiation for the sins committed between it and the previous one.'

conditions: Being of sound mind and maturity
Women must be accompanied by a mahram (according to majority opinion)
pillars_of_umrah: Ihram (intention and entering the sacred state)
steps_of_umrah: Enter Ihram from the Miqat and recite the Talbiyah: 'Labbayk Allahumma labbayk...'
Reach the Masjid al-Haram and perform Tawaf around the Ka'bah (7 times, counter-clockwise)
Pray 2 rak’ahs near Maqam Ibrahim (if possible)
Perform Sa’i between Safa and Marwah (7 times)
End Umrah by shaving (Halq) or trimming (Taqsir) the hair
recommended_etiquettes: Have sincere intention for Allah alone
Be patient and avoid arguments or distractions
Increase in dhikr, dua, and prayer
Avoid harming others during crowded rites

hadiths.text: Umrah during Ramadan is equivalent to Hajj (in reward).
One Umrah to another is an expiation for what is between them.

benefits: Closeness to Allah and the Prophet’s ﷺ legacy
Reminds one of the Day of Judgment
